channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: Futurelock: A subtle risk in async Rust
item.description:
This function only // returns once the lock has been taken in the background task. Returns once the task is holding the lock. At this point:the background task holds the lockthe main task is blocked in tokio::select.

Read more

item.title: Use DuckDB-WASM to query TB of data in browser
item.description:
As part of our Public Data Project, LIL recently launched Data. However, static hosting often diminishes the capacity for rich data discovery. Here’s how it works: Data storage: We store Data.

Read more

item.title: Perfetto: Swiss army knife for Linux client tracing
item.description:
First, what is Perfetto. It’s a C++ library that parses the protobuf format, but also a bunch of other widely used trace formats. It’s very important to note that even though the Perfetto UI is web-based, everything happens inside your browser and trace data never leaves your system.

Read more

item.title: Leaker reveals which Pixels are vulnerable to Cellebrite phone hacking
item.description:
The screenshot includes data on the Pixel 6, Pixel 7, Pixel 8, and Pixel 9 family. This blurry screenshot appears to list which Pixel phones Cellebrite devices can hack. Credit: rogueFed This blurry screenshot appears to list which Pixel phones Cellebrite devices can hack.

Read more

item.title: How to build silos and decrease collaboration on purpose
item.description:
Increasing collaboration can do harm In general, you should aim to maximize collaboration within teams, and minimize collaboration between teams. Why maximize collaboration within teams. Why minimize collaboration between teams.

Read more

item.title: A theoretical way to circumvent Android developer verification
item.description:
Link to the Android documentation, link to FAQ Why this is bad This has already been discussed by ArsTechnica and on some threads (some cherry-picked ones): reddit, ycombinator, hackaday. My answer to this question is that it would simply prevent small developers from distributing their apps, including myself. This can be achieved by patching the target apk bytecode:.

Read more

item.title: If a pilot ejects, what is the autopilot programmed to do? (2018)
item.description:
There is nothing much autopilot can do at that point. There have been two famous incidents that are related to your question but afaik neither of them involve Auto Pilot. Hence I'm sorry I don't have an answer to that question.

Read more
